versions.raw_html:
The following has special meaning:
green underline denotes added text
red struck out text denotes deleted text
2025 CT S 447
Author: Anwar
Version: Introduced
Version Date: 01/09/2025

STATE OF CONNECTICUT

General Assembly

Proposed Bill No. 447

January Session, 2025

LCO No. 122

*00122*

Referred to Committee on INSURANCE AND REAL ESTATE

Introduced by:

SEN. ANWAR, 3rd Dist.

AN ACT PROHIBITING HEALTH CARRIERS FROM USING ARTIFICIAL INTELLIGENCE IN THE EVALUATION AND DETERMINATION OF PATIENT CARE.

Be it enacted by the Senate and House of Representatives in General Assembly convened:

That title 38a of the general statutes be amended to prohibit health carriers from using artificial intelligence in the evaluation and determination of patient care to safeguard patient access to testing, medications and procedures.

Statement of Purpose:

To prohibit health carriers from using artificial intelligence in the evaluation and determination of patient care to safeguard patient access to testing, medications and procedures.
